timeline.message:
add method for logging current status of CR

Signed-off-by: Lukas Kral <lkral@redhat.com>

timeline.bodyText: Are you sure it's set everytime?
timeline.author: Frawless

timeline.bodyText: Why you don't get there CR via client like you do for other cases?
timeline.author: Frawless
Frawless

timeline.bodyText: You don't need to have this generic I think. Or maybe update it to accept resources which has status? In that case you should change the naming.
timeline.author: Frawless

timeline.bodyText: For this and all the other waitFor*() methods, when and why don't you want to have the debug logging on timeout? In other words, what are the callers of waitForConnectorStatus(String name, String state) doing that means they're not needing the debug logging?
timeline.author: tombentley
see-quick
see-quick

timeline.bodyText: nice use of generics :) but please make sure when you  defining it, create some doc, where you explain, which set of types can be contains T type.
timeline.author: see-quick

timeline.bodyText: What else here can be here like Deployment?  Please write some documentation explaining what can be T, it will make more sense for the person who will use it after you :).
timeline.author: see-quick
see-quick

replies.bodyText: This is used in case you don't want to onTimeout code execution - nothing will happen, just empty lambda - empty runnable - if you have any idea how to do it better - I'm open for any ideas. I think this is good if we don't want to display anything in tests after timeout exception is thrown.
replies.author: im-konge

timeline.bodyText: Again some documentation will be supportive.. )
